content.question: Which of the following is a right Riemann sum for <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 4, of, the arc tangent of, open parenthesis, 1 plus x, close parenthesis, d x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, the arc tangent of, open parenthesis, 1 plus the fraction k over n, close parenthesis, times the fraction 1 over n, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, the arc tangent of, open parenthesis, 4 plus the fraction k over n, close parenthesis, times the fraction 1 over n, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, the arc tangent of, open parenthesis, 1 plus the fraction 3 k over n, close parenthesis, times the fraction 3 over n, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, the arc tangent of, open parenthesis, 2 plus the fraction 3 k over n, close parenthesis, times the fraction 3 over n, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, the arc tangent of, open parenthesis, 2 plus the fraction 3 k over n, close parenthesis, times the fraction 3 over n, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>arctan</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo><mo>⋅</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.3: Riemann Sums, Summation Notation, and Definite Integral Notation

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
